body_html:
The colab in the master branch is in sync with the code in the master branch (where tf.Variable is supported). However, the last release (1.9, 1.10-rc0) do not yet support it.

This seems like a bug on on website, where the www.tensorflow.org/tutorials should link to the colabs in the appropriate release branch, not the ones in master.

@MarkDaoust @wolffg @lamberta - Could you help with that?

@yufengg : Apologies for the confusion. For now, could you replace master with say r1.9 to get to the right colab. i.e.,

https://colab.research.google.com/github/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.9/tensorflow/contrib/eager/python/examples/notebooks/eager_basics.ipynb

instead of

https://colab.research.google.com/github/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/eager/python/examples/notebooks/eager_basics.ipynb

body:
The colab in the `master` branch is in sync with the code in the `master` branch (where `tf.Variable` is supported). However, the last release (1.9, 1.10-rc0) do not yet support it.

This seems like a bug on on website, where the www.tensorflow.org/tutorials should link to the colabs in the appropriate release branch, not the ones in master.

@MarkDaoust @wolffg @lamberta - Could you help with that?

@yufengg : Apologies for the confusion. For now, could you replace `master` with say `r1.9` to get to the right colab. i.e.,

https://colab.research.google.com/github/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.9/tensorflow/contrib/eager/python/examples/notebooks/eager_basics.ipynb

instead of

https://colab.research.google.com/github/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/eager/python/examples/notebooks/eager_basics.ipynb
